section.title: Install NSX Manager
section.p: This is an example of a newly deployed environment with high availability enabled for the NSX-V edge pool services. In this example resource pools are used to organize resources and VMs on the control plane. However, VMware normally recommends you use folders in the VMs and Templates inventory if all you need to do is organize VMs.

For best practices concerning NSX design, see the Reference Design: VMwareÂ® NSX for vSphere (NSX)Network Virtualization Design Guide (Clicking this link automatically downloads a PDF file instead of opening a Web page.)
section.note: It is recommended that each cluster has storage that is shared between the ESXi hosts. Each compute cluster is required to have shared storage, otherwise attempts to create instances through nova-compute will fail!
Before installing the NSX manager, verify that the MTU setting on each Distributed Virtual Switch (DVS) is set to 1600. This is usually done automatically when preparing the environment for NSX.

ol.li: In a browser, navigate to the NSX download URL provided by VMware after purchase of software.
From the VMware web site, download the following file: NSX Manager OVF To make the appliance installation easier, download the file to the machine where vSphere client is installed.
From the computer were vSphere client is installed, launch the vSphere client.
